bib.title: Two-body photodisintegration of He-3 and He-4 in thedelta(1236) region.

free_txt: Corrected  by   V.Varlamov:  dates, doi,
lowercase.
Entry deleted because of duplication with M0591.
For each run characterized by a given set of
kinematical conditions two-dimensional histograms
for the energy losses in the spectrometer detectors
were established and protons (and electrons and
pions also) was clear-cut identified.
The corrections were made for:
- proton absorption in the copper absorber situated
in front of the telescope (this correction never
exceeded 15%);
- counting losses due to the high counting rate in
the telescope scintillators (this correction was
estimated to be 2 - 8%);
- events originating in the target walls (this
correction was estimated to be about 1.5%).
Differential cross sections for the reactions
He-3(g,p)d and He-4(g,p)t were measured at proton
c.m. angles of 60 and 90 degrees for photon
energies ranging from 150 to 450 mev with an
average resolution of 8 MeV. Deuterons and tritons
were analyzed in a magnetic spectrometer whereas
coincident protons were detected in a plastic
scintillator telescope. The He-3 and He-4 two-body
photodisintegration differential cross sections show
a monotonically decreasing variation with photon
energy. In addition, partial data on the differential
cross section of the reaction He-4(g,n)He-3 at 90
and 120 degrees of neutron c.m. angle are given.     M
Magnetic spectrometer and plastic
scintillators.
Kinematically determined (reaction
particle tagged) energy of incident photon.
Bremsstrahlung was used as a photon source, but the
the energy of the photon originating the reaction
event is determined by the momentum of the particle
particle analyzed in the magnetic spectrometer.
The liquid He-3 (temperature of 2.6 degrees K and
average thickness of 0.132 (0.012) g/cm**2) and
He-4 (temperature of 4.2 degrees k and average
thickness of 0.131 (0.12) g/cm**2) targets.
